meanings.sent1: She glugged down the water after a long run.
meanings.sent2: He always glugged his soda when he was thirsty.
meanings.sent3: The little girl glugged her juice so fast, she got the hiccups.
meanings.sent4: The river glugged down the mountainside, eager to reach the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The horse glugged the water from the trough, its thirst finally quenched.

meanings.definition: To make a gurgling sound while drinking
meanings.sent1: The baby glugged happily as she drank her milk.
meanings.sent2: The stream glugged softly as it flowed over the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The old teapot glugged noisily as it poured out the tea.
meanings.sent4: The drain glugged as the water spiraled down it.
meanings.sent5: The fountain glugged rhythmically, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To pour liquid with a gurgling sound
meanings.sent1: She glugged the lemonade into the pitcher, the bubbles popping.
meanings.sent2: He glugged the oil into the engine, making sure it was full.
meanings.sent3: The waterfall glugged down the rocks, creating a beautiful cascade.
meanings.sent4: The rain glugged from the gutter, splashing onto the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The bartender glugged the beer into the glass, foam overflowing slightly.
